term.title: photodecarbonylation

notes.item: Typical example is the Norrish Type I photoreaction, in which, after production of the diradical upon photoinduced Î±-cleavage, CO is eliminated. This reaction has been widely exploited for the production of radicals in crystals, as well as for the synthesis of cyclic compounds. PT07453.png
Another example is the photodecarbonylation of alpha-aryl aldehydes.
